title: Firmware Build and Release Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for invention and self-challenge? Do you thrive on pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of a best-in-class modem team, you’ll craft sophisticated innovative embedded firmware that delivers more performance in our products than ever before! You’ll work across teams to transform improved hardware elements into a single, integrated design. Join us, and you’ll help us innovate new wireless systems technologies that continually outperform the previous iterations. By collaborating with other product development groups across Apple, you’ll push the industry boundaries of what wireless systems can do and improve the product experience for our customers across the world.
description: Here, you'll accomplish firmware work for various projects, and support firmware deliverables for bring-up activities and factory camps across pre-silicon to post-silicon. Fix and resolve sophisticated software integration and build issues from Pre-int to post-processing. Coordinate multi-functionally and align on the dependencies, requirements, and release readiness, ensuring delivery completion, consistency, and high code quality, to meet achievements and branch-out readiness criteria. Configure and implement tooling for CI automation, triage and debug of Pre-int issues. Identify useful new technologies that can improve efficiency and reliability and incorporate them into build release workflows, development tools, and processes.
key_qualifications: Experience with Git, Gerrit, GitLab, CI/CD, make, cmake, xtensa compiler; Deep understanding of continuous integration and delivery workflow, as well as branching strategies; Experience with Jenkins pipelines and Groovy/Shell/Python scripting; Experience with Python code development and/or Tableau is a plus; Excellent communication and collaboration skills cross-team and projects; Excellent problem-solving and build debugging skills, continuous improvement, and optimization ability on the delivery toolchain; BS and 3+ years of relevant industry experience is required. A bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or computer science is and/or MSEE is preferred.
education_experience: BS and 3+ years of relevant industry experience is required.
